We are UMG, the Universal Music Group. We are the world’s leading music company. In everything we do, we are committed to artistry, innovation and entrepreneurship. We own and operate a broad array of businesses engaged in recorded music, music publishing, merchandising, and audiovisual content in more than 60 countries. We identify and develop recording artists and songwriters, and we produce, distribute and promote the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful music to delight and entertain fans around the world.How We LEADThis position will be responsible for leading efforts to deliver business analytics & reporting capabilities for the UMG Physical Supply Chain Operations group working alongside a community of business and data analysts, data architects and software engineers.How You'll CREATEDevelop data analytics & reporting program roadmap for physical supply chain operations groupCollaborate with department-level managers to collect and define reporting requirementsConduct workshop with cross-functional teams to design and deliver reports and dashboardsDefine Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), target goals, and how KPIs will be calculated, tracked and visualizedUtilize KPI’s to facilitate monthly and quarterly business performance review sessionsPrepare ad-hoc reports to provide insights and trends to support operational activities and continuous improvements initiativesWork across technology teams to extract, transform and load data from multiple sources into a common repository for analytics and reportingPerform analysis and validation to ensure quality and accuracy of dataManage testing and implementation of reporting dashboards working with IT and/or external partnersParticipate in data governance and data privacy committees within the companyBring Your VIBEMinimum 7 years of experience in similar positionsAbility to collect, organize, measure and analyze dataExperience utilizing reporting software packages like Tableau, Domo, Business Objects, MicroStrategyKnowledge of data integration and data modelling toolsBasic understanding of structured querry language (SQL)Knowledge of supply chain processes (order-to-cash & procure-to-pay) and associated operational models and datasetsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work in a global workforce environment and across organizational boundariesStrong planning, influencing and negotiation skillsAbility to lead small project teams and manage schedules and deliverablesMust be results driven, demonstrates adaptability, flexibility, and resourcefulnessB.S. in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Sciences or equivalentPerks PlaylistBe part of an entrepreneurial, global organization that values authenticity, drive, creativity, relationships, and a competitive spiritComprehensive medical, dental, vision, and FSA options, as well as:100% coverage for out-patient mental health servicesWellbeing reimbursements for fitness classes, spa treatments, meal services, travel, and so much more (up to $720/year)A lifetime fertility support allowance of $30,000 to plan participantsStudent Loan Repayment Assistance and Tuition Reimbursement100% immediately vested 401(k) match on the first 5% of your contribution on eligible compensationVariety of ways to prioritize much-needed time away from work including:Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) for exempt employees3-weeks PTO for non-exempt employees2-weeks paid Winter Break10 Paid Holidays (including Juneteenth and Wellbeing Day)Summer Fridays (between Memorial Day and Labor Day)Generous paid parental leave for every type of parentDisclaimer: This job description only provides an overview of job responsibilities that are subject to change.All UMG employees are currently required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or provide proof of a negative PCR or Antigen test before entering any Company offices unless they have been approved for an exemption or unless prohibited by applicable law. Universal Music Group is an Equal Opportunity EmployerWe are an E-Verify employer.For more information, please click on the following links.E-Verify Participation Poster: English / SpanishE-Verify Right to Work Poster: English | SpanishJob CategoryManufacturing, Logistics & Supply ChainSalary Range$112,023 - $209,220The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include, as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job. All candidates are encouraged to apply.
